patient_info: Muscle weakness,Pericardial effusion,Abnormal tricuspid valve morphology,Palpitations,Vomiting,Abdominal pain,Dyspnea,Exercise intolerance,Poor appetite,Vascular tortuosity,Atrial fibrillation,Tricuspid regurgitation,Pedal edema,Right bundle branch block,Abnormal ST segment,Left ventricular systolic dysfunction,Right atrial enlargement,Increased circulating NT-proBNP concentration,Left atrial enlargement,Abnormality of internal jugular vein
golden_diagnosis: Cardiomyopathy, familial restrictive, 1,家族性/特发性限制型心肌病/Familial/Idiopathic restrictive cardiomyopathy,Cardiomyopathy, familial restrictive, 3,Cardiomyopathy, dilated, 1KK,Cardiomyopathy, familial hypertrophic, 26
predict_diagnosis:
1. Myopathy, muscular dystrophy or metabolic muscle disease
2. Inflammatory muscle disease (e.g., polymyositis, dermatomyositis)
3. Cardiomyopathy or myocarditis
4. Pericarditis or post-pericardiotomy syndrome
5. Valvular heart disease (e.g., rheumatic valve disease, congenital heart disease)
6. Atrial septal defect (ASD) or ventricular septal defect (VSD)
7. Heart failure (e.g., left ventricular dysfunction, right ventricular dysfunction)
8. Hypertensive heart disease
9. Coronary artery disease or myocardial ischemia
10. Thoracic outlet syndrome or carotid artery dissection

Please note that these top 10 diagnoses are based on the provided patient phenotype and are meant to be a starting point for further evaluation and diagnostic workup. It is essential to consider other rare or less likely conditions as well, and the final diagnosis should be established after thorough clinical assessment, laboratory tests, and imaging studies.
